page.title: 01GENERAL SURVEY
page.content: LAWRENCE ST.AREA.YORK CITY SUBURB. This area is largely a Victorian working class subUrb of York that grew around the main road from York to Hull(Lawrence St.).This remains a very busy arterial road.To the South the ground rises on to the York Morraine,while on the Northern side is a large area of waste ground,once a Council tip but now abandoned and colonised by natural vegetation.On the ridge St.Lawrence's Church stands,the spire of which can be seen from all parts of the area.Many of the terrace houses in the Lawrence St.area have been demolished and an area of light industry has been developed.at the Western edge the Medieval City walls still stand pierced by a barbicaned gateway.On the N.E.edge lies a now unused railway yard.
